snippet: “Rape and pillage are not part of the curriculum,” said the director of a government-funded course on how to live like a Norse warrior, though image redemption is.
abstract: Seljord Journal; Norwegian government funds college level continuing education class on living like a Viking, capitalizing on resurgence of interest in country's Viking past; curriculum emphasizes culture's art and crafts, bravery and curiosity, and eschews its violent history and right-wing nationalist associations, in effort to rehabilitate tradition.

byline.contributor: Henrik Pryser Libell contributed reporting from Oslo.

lead_paragraph: “Rape and pillage are not part of the curriculum,” said the director of a government-funded course on how to live like a Norse warrior, though image redemption is.

headline.print_headline: Norway Hails Vikings Again, Minus the Pillaging
headline.main: Norway Again Embraces the Vikings, Minus the Violence
